name: Halloween Tips for Treats
description: Halloween doesn’t have to be a nightmare for your dental health. Some small tricks can help you enjoy treats in a healthy way.

affiliation.name: County of San Diego Communications Office

articleContent:
Halloween doesn’t have to be a nightmare for your dental health. Some small tricks can help you enjoy treats in a healthy way. 
County of San Diego Chief Dental Officer, Dr. Fadra Whyte, DMD, MPH shares some tips backed by the American Dental Association: 

Don’t eat all the candy – pick out your favorites and donate the rest. 
Chocolate is better for your teeth than other hard or sticky candies. Dark chocolate has less sugar than milk chocolate and doesn’t stick to your teeth like caramels or gummies. 
Eat your candy with a meal. The food and saliva in your mouth help rinse away little bits of candy and bacteria that cause cavities.
Chew sugarless gum for 20 minutes after eating a piece of candy to help clean your teeth. 
Most importantly, brush your teeth after eating candy.  

Happy Halloween!
